Perform TockyKmeansRF Analysis with Optional ROC Evaluation

Source: R/TockyRandomForestAnalysis.R
TockyRandomForestAnalysis.Rd

This function performs the TockyKmeansRF analysis across multiple runs and optionally evaluates the ROC curves and calculates the AUC for each run. It can handle a single number of clusters or a vector of cluster numbers. The importance scores are accumulated across runs, and data is plotted based on these scores.

Usage

TockyRandomForestAnalysis(
  trainData,
  testData,
  num_cluster = 16,
  k = 100,
  percentile = 0.5,
  ROC = FALSE,
  verbose = TRUE,
  ctrl_group = NULL,
  expr_group = NULL,
  iter.max = 100,
  nstart = 1
)

Arguments

trainData

Training dataset as a TockyPrepData object.

testData

Test dataset as a TockyPrepData object.

num_cluster

A single integer specifying the number of clusters to evaluate.

k

Integer, number of repetitions for the analysis.

percentile

Numeric, percentile threshold for importance scores (between 0 and 1).

ROC

Logical, whether to perform ROC analysis.

verbose

Logical indicating whether to print progress messages and outputs. Default is TRUE.

ctrl_group

The name of the control group within `sampledef`.

expr_group

The name of the experimental group within `sampledef`.

iter.max

the maximum number of iterations allowed. To be passed to kmeans.

nstart

the number of random sets to be used in each clustering. To be passed to kmeans.

Value

A list containing the accumulated importance scores, optional ROC results, AUC values, and plots.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
result <- TockyRandomForestAnalysis(trainData, testData, num_cluster = 16, k = 100, ROC = TRUE)
} # }
